reference.title: DumpInstallFileStatusTool
reference.shortdesc: DumpInstallFileStatusTool checks the capabilities of executables within a SIS file against the capabilities supported by the signing certificates and displays the missing capabilities corresponding to each executable.

refsyn.title: Syntax
refsyn.p: The following table lists all the options supported by DumpInstallFileStatusTool.
The following table lists the arguments to be specified with DumpInstallFileStatusTool:

entry.p: Specifies the name of the signed SIS file, whose capabilites are required to be validated against the signing certificates.
Specifies the location of the swicerstore.dat file on the ROM (For example, Z:\resource\swicertstore.dat). Optional if Directory is specified.
Specifies the location of the writable swicertstore.dat file (For example, c:\resource\swicertstore\dat\ ). Optional if DATFile is provided.
Note: The tool lists all missing capabilities except the user-specified capabilities specified at the command prompt.

refsyn.p: Important: You must specify the arguments in the same order as shown in the following command line:

example.title: Examples
example.p: The following examples illustrates the usage of DumpInstallFileStatusTool:

li.p: To extract and display the missing capabilities for all the executables of a SIS file.
This command lists all the executables and their capability status at the command prompt as shown in the following sample output:
li.codeblock:
Executable :
c:\sys\bin\initLogger.exe
FILE STATUS : Capabilities are not satisfied .
Missing Capabilities List :
CommDD PowerMgmt MultimediaDD ReadDeviceData WriteDeviceData DRM TrustedUI ProtServ DiskAdmin NetworkControl AllFiles SwEvent NetworkServices LocalServices ReadUserData WriteUserData Location SurroundingsDD UserEnvironment .... .... ....
Executable :
c:\sys\bin\closeLogger.exe
FILE STATUS : Capabilities are not satisfied .
Missing Capabilities List :
CommDD PowerMgmt MultimediaDD ReadDeviceData WriteDeviceData DRM TrustedUI ProtServ DiskAdmin NetworkControl AllFiles SwEvent NetworkServices LocalServices ReadUserData WriteUserData Location SurroundingsDD UserEnvironment

li.p: To specify the user-specified capabilities at the command prompt:
This command excludes the specified capabilities from the missing capability list as shown in the following sample output:
li.codeblock:
Executable :
c:\sys\bin\initLogger.exe
FILE STATUS : Capabilities are not satisfied .
Missing Capabilities List :
CommDD PowerMgmt MultimediaDD ReadDeviceData WriteDeviceData DRM TrustedUI ProtServ DiskAdmin NetworkControl AllFiles SwEvent NetworkServices LocalServices
Location SurroundingsDD UserEnvironment .... .... ....
Executable :
c:\sys\bin\closeLogger.exe
FILE STATUS : Capabilities are not satisfied .
Missing Capabilities List :
CommDD PowerMgmt MultimediaDD ReadDeviceData WriteDeviceData DRM TrustedUI ProtServ DiskAdmin NetworkControl AllFiles SwEvent NetworkServices LocalServices
Location SurroundingsDD UserEnvironment
li.p: Note that the ReadUserData WriteUserData are not displayed in the list.
